author: cnbc.com
title: MEDIA ALERT: Achronixâ€™s Steve Mensor Joins Expert Panel Addressing eFPGA Ecosystem During NDIA
text:
Session Part of Day-Long Workshop Designed to Improve Information Sharing, Collaboration on eFPGA IP, Firmware Assurance MITRE Corporation Hosts Event to be held February 27
SANTA CLARA, Calif., Feb. 26, 2018 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) --
WHO: Steve Mensor, vice president of marketing for Achronix Semiconductor Corporation , a leader in field programmable gate array (FPGA)-based hardware accelerator devices and embedded FPGA (eFPGA) intellectual property (IP)
WHAT: Will participate on a panel discussion the eFPGA Ecosystem during the National Defense Industrial Association (NDIA) workshop on FPGA Assurance
WHEN: Tuesday, February 27, from 3:45 p.m. until 4:45 p.m.
WHERE: MITRE Corporation in McLean, Virginia
The second NDIA workshop on FPGA assurance, will explore the emerging area of eFPGA IP and firmware assurance. The workshop will offer a special panel discussing FPGA assurance concerns in application-level development, and soliciting community feedback on the proposed assurance strategy.
More information can be found at: http://bit.ly/2EQhPif
About Achronix Semiconductor Corporation
Achronix is a privately held, fabless semiconductor corporation based in Santa Clara, California. The company developed its FPGA technology which is the basis of the Speedster22i FPGAs and Speedcore eFPGA technology. All Achronix FPGA products are supported by its ACE design tools that include integrated support for Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS) Synplify Pro.
The company has sales offices and representatives in the United States, Europe, and China, and has a research and design office in Bangalore, India.
